reviews.text: I love going to this place from time to time if you want a lot of variety of dim sums. The place is spacious, it has valet parking which is great if you're in Flushing. The food taste and atmostphere is just like most dim sum/chinese places that's why I gave it a 4 star as compared to 5.
Great experience with the carts coming around. But if you never been ask the cost so you arenâ€™t left clueless.
Eggplant dish 10/10
Excellente cuisine: goÃ»teuse, prÃ©cise et variÃ©e. Le restaurant est immense et par consÃ©quent il est bruyant mais Ã§a ne gÃ¢che pas l'expÃ©rience car on se concentre vite sur son assiette.
very old fashioned Cantonese restaurant. Good tasteï¼

If you are looking for an authentic and tradition Cantonese dishes, Asian Jewel is your best choice, has thousands of options and taste of your favorite on the menu with quality services and place fill with traditional Chinese culture renovation inside the restaurant

Do not come here. After coming here for the last couple of times, I will not come here again.

Came here on a Thursday around 12pm and the service was terrible. They clearly didnâ€™t have enough staff â€” we had to ask 2â€“3 times for simple things and they never brought them over. Very disorganized and frustrating experience.

Iâ€™ll most likely go take my business to another dim sum spot from now on. Very disappointing.
This restaurant is a lot bigger than it looks.  Go there early if your group is max of 10 people. No need to reserve a table.
We were in the Overflow room which is a lower quality experience than the main dining room
Great dim sum spot in flushing, all the food is fresh and yummy. Good for big and small parties alike
My wife and I, we were the first customers today at 9AM. Everything was what we had expected. Starting today, this place is our special regular go to restaurant. Awesome!.....

Food is average; parking lot employee is rude.
Great spot in flushing for dim sum. The wait times can get pretty long during the weekends, but the food overall is great and priced well. Nice perk that they have a valet lot.

So much good dim sum that gets pushed around on carts. Cart ladies can get a bit aggressive but youâ€™ll never lack food options. Service is overall a bit inconsistent and all over the place but youâ€™ll adapt. Egg tarts here were very good.

One of the better dim sum places in flushing, though be prepared for a long wait on weekends.  Great for large parties, as they have a lot of seating. Some items were a little off perfection, but overall a good experience. They also have a parking lot, but will fill up fast on weekends.

It's not a hole in the wall, but prices are still reasonable.
Super miejsce. Bardzo smaczna kuchnia. Personel stara siÄ™ Å¼eby kaÅ¼dy zostaÅ‚ szybko obsÅ‚uÅ¼ony. Miejsce warte odwiedzenia.

I lived in HK for any years and NY Chinese has always been deficient. (San Jose has better). But this place was like being back in HK. Food was excellent, dim sum close to perfect.  Just wish it was closer to me.
Amazing food!

As a loyal customer who used to go multiple times per year, I am saddened by how much the quality of food has dropped.

Prices have gone up since the restaurant was featured on the michelin guide, the food is cold and the flavor is definitely not as good as it used to be.
Great dim sum!

Beautiful Restaurant
Delicious food all round

The restaurant is located at the heart of Flushing in Queens. The traffic is crowed. The food is okay but the price is high. We had 3 people to have dinner last week, and it costs around $200 with tip. The white rice on the bowl was dry. The vegetable didn't taste well. We ordered a 2.25 lb fresh fish with soup and meal,  the taste was good.
Authentic dimsum in carts, great value for money
Often a line but worth the wait. Clean and efficient with dim sum carts

I came here with a couple of friends for an early dinner on a random saturday. We were seated immediately despite the restaurant being quote busy. Before we even sat down, the servers were already offering us platesâ€”so be prepared to start eating right away!

The food itself was delicious and very unique for the american palate. My friends and I particularly liked the siu mai and cheong fun.  However the experience can feel overwhelming if youâ€™re not familiar with dim sum.The dishes come around quickly, and it was sometimes hard to understand what the staff were saying due to both the noise level and a language barrier. Some of the items are pictured in the menu, and at the front of the restaurant thereâ€™s a complete list of items in both English and Chinese, which is really helpful.

The dim sum servers were friendly and never too pushy, which I appreciated. The only downside was trying to flag down a regular waiter for some water. When we finally did get someones attention he was a bit rude and told us to wait though no one brought us water until we asked a different waiter 15 minutes later.

Overall, the food makes this place worth visiting. Itâ€™s delicious and authentic. Be ready for a fast-paced, lively atmosphere, and maybe brush up on dim sum basics beforehand to make the experience smoother.
Reliable, fast dim sum in Flushing.

I always loved Asian Jewels.  I have been coming here for years but am only now getting around to reviewing it. In my last visit, the food was good as always (though some dishes could have been warmer) and the dim sum carts came around frequently with a good variety of food. What really stood out on this visit, though, was the super-attentive service.  We rarely ever had to wait for anything we needed which is a huge accomplishment for a large place that serves the amount of customers they get.  Not sure if the stars were aligned or if we just got lucky, but it was a great visit.  I am sure we will be back.
å‘³é“ä¸€èˆ¬
Really tasty food. I liked the hot tea ready at the table quickly after we were seated and watermelon was a very nice touch to cleanse the palate after eating
My go to flushing dim sum stop. My favorite item is the durian pastry bun. Thereâ€™s always wait but itâ€™s been mostly fast
food was great . so pax . so loud .  wait a line . not easy to order. wait a cart long time . asked for sweet sauce never get . but yes I will come back ğŸ˜‚

The food is delicious, my girlfriend, her friend and I had an unforgettable dinner, the service and attention was perfect, we ordered a crab, which before preparing it they brought it to our table (live) to approve it, the fish soup equally very good flavor in general all the food is delicious
Food was exceptional. I love dimsum in push carts!
First time dining here tonight after reading their reviews. We order chicken meehoon and soft tofu with veggies. Both dishes tasted great and not too salty. Highly recommend this restaurant!

We went for dinner and our waiter was very rude, correcting our Chinese and upselling us everything. We had ordered small portions. He said it wasn't enough so he has us ordering the large portions. At the end of the night the bill was over $1,000 for 13 of us. We asked him before he placed the order to repeat it to us. He said don't worry about it. We will never be visiting this place again. If you go, make sure they repeat your order and tell you how much it's going to be. Otherwise you could be paying a lot more than you wanted to. We ended up taking a lot of food home with us so it was actually too much food. We over ordered on his request.
Awesome Dim Sum experience.
Home made tofu å±±æ°´è±†è…èŠ± must have!! A lot of choices for dim sum and the service is good.

Good Chinese food in Flushing! They have a large space with lots of tables for big parties. They also have several private rooms available. The food is pretty standard compared to other restaurants in the area. One thing I didnâ€™t like was that a lot of their sauces tasted similar with a hint of tomato like for the Peking Duck and the Pork Chops. Price was a bit expensive. Service was good. Parking lot with valet in the back, but gets hectic at the end.

Locale molto grande con diverse stanze e tavoli sia per poche persone sia per gruppi. Viene assegnato un numero di attesa e si aspetta fino a che non Ã¨ proprio il proprio tavolo. Il dim sum consiste in carrelli che portano piatti da scegliere e condividere in un tavolo rotondo con una superficie rotante per far girare i piatti in modo che tutti possano assaggiarli. Locale inevitabilmente rumoroso e nella seconda stanza i tavoli sobo un po' vicini tra di loro. Prezzi tutto sommato giusti. Serve conoscere il cinese.  Nel complesso un buon ristorante.

Nice authentic dim sum experience. There are a lot of options on push carts.  Although , a lot of dishes include shrimp which my husband is allergic to so more limited for us. Favorites include the chicken feet, meat and taro wrapped in tofu skin, and coconut pudding. We got there early when they opened around 9 on the weekend,  however the kitchen doesnâ€™t open until 10:30 so many things on the dim sum special list werenâ€™t available.

I had a fun time here with 6 of my pals. Unfortunately we came at 3:33pm, unaware that the carts ended at 3:30. The sign said the dimsun ended at 4:00 not 3:30. We were still able to get dim-sun but just had to order them specifically and wait longer. The dim-sun was pretty tasty, although I would have liked the pork buns more if they had more meat inside. The soup dumplings also didnâ€™t have much soup insight which was a bit disappointing. The tripe was great though. We had a great time but I recommend coming before 3:30pm for the best experience.

Asian Jewels (æ•¦åŸæµ·é²œé…’æ¥¼) is a classic Cantonese dim sum hall with food carts still roaming between tablesâ€”fast, loud, and nostalgic. We came on a packed weekend morning and got seated instantly. Within minutes, food was on the table.

We had all the staplesâ€”shumai, chicken feet, congee, fish balls, shrimp dumplings, milk buns. Everything was solid, nothing mind-blowing, but very true to the old-school experience. Service was efficient, no frills.

The space is huge and hectic, but thatâ€™s part of the charm. Price is totally reasonableâ€”three people ate well for about $70 with tips. Not the best dim sum in town, but if you want that bustling, cart-pushing vibe without the wait, this spot delivers.

We loved the ham sui gok (crispy dumpling), pineapple BBQ pork buns, and the surprisingly good durian mochi! Some items were less exciting thoughâ€”the tofu pudding lacked flavor, and the congee with century egg and pork was a bit underwhelming. But overall, the experience was great, with friendly service.
Decent place to get dim sum. My favorite is the steamed shrimp ball with bits of water chestnut for the light crunch cooked in egg white sauce. Do go early to avoid crowds on weekends.

Really good Dim Sum Restaurant in NYC. I got Dim Sum for lunch and it's really nice. They have long cue for the table but it run fast. Seating area are large. Dim Sum come in the cart and you have to pick what you want and they will write down in the paper of your table then you give it to the staff for payment. Taste are really good like the one I had in Hong Kong. Rice roll are tasty especially the fried Chinese dough are really good. They have their own parking lot for free. Enjoy !

Updated May 2025
Everything is good as it been. Same good taste, hot tasty dim-sum i had in NYC.
Excellent dim sum. The shumai, pork buns, sesame balls and egg tarts off the carts were great. We also ordered the Green beans with pork and it was very good.

Dim sum is good , push cart ladies are sweet and polite so are the managers in suits. Huge dinning space with many rooms and the wait number calling goes fast. The plus side of this place is no need to share tables and a lot less shouting and noise.

Very delightful dim sum brunch experience.

I had heard great things about this place but didnâ€™t expect it to be the best dim sum Iâ€™ve ever had. We only tried three dishes, but each one was perfect. I should mention there may be some bias since these are our usual favourites to order, but they were still the best Iâ€™ve ever had. They also have cart ladies pushing around the dishes, which is awesome to see since many dim sum spots I go to no longer do this. I can definitely see why this place was Michelin-recommended in the past.

Good Cantonese Chinese banquet type food, served family style.  $100 per person, but we went all out, pre-ordering a suckling pig for our dinner.  We had three tables.  We come here for dim sum too.  Good food.  Valet parking lot.  They have private rooms also.
Overall the food is pretty good. The atmosphere is very good. Traditional Chinese dim sum restaurant with food carts. Bring back my childhood memory. Recommend!

This dim sum restaurant in Flushing has a long history and offers very authentic flavors. It is also very popular, and as the area continues to develop, the restaurant has become even busier. To avoid long waits, I recommend going before 11 AM or between 2-3 PM to avoid peak times.

They offer dim sum with pushcart service, allowing you to choose your favorite dishes. Since the dim sum is made fresh, it's always delicious. Compared to many other dim sum places, most of their dishes are impeccable in both taste and presentation. In addition to dim sum, they also offer typical Cantonese stir-fry dishes and noodles. It's an excellent choice for dim sum.

Looking for dim sum & then some - very large pieces & flavorful. No dipping sauce though? What do I know about authentic Asian food. My lovely server brought me some soy sauce. Tried the beef & mango and it was ok. Nice little touches with tea, peanuts & sliced fresh fruit after the meal. Very attentive service. Overall nice experience in Flushing.

Excellent option for family dinner or dinner with friends. Staff is friendly and they have many traditional options. Even American Chinese options are available. Food is excellent quality and the service is very quick. Everything came out within 20-25 minutes. Lobster fried rice is excellent and fresh. Chicken was super tender and not dry at all. Eggplant was hot and fresh, not too salty. The shrimp was plump and cooked perfectly. Tofu was great. Green beans were excellent. Fish was great too. Canâ€™t say enough good things about this place. Used to come here for dim sum as a kid and that was excellent too. Will definitely be back in the future.

Excellent first experience here. After having enjoyed many dim sum meals in Hong Kong and New York, this was definitely one of the better and most authentic Cantonese dim sum meals that Iâ€™ve had in quite some time. The place is quite large and quite busy so there are always fresh items coming out in the carts. Some of my favorites were the shumai and the hargow, rice rolls were also very good with shrimp although we were told that you need to order the char siu rice roll separately, which I thought was a little strange. Will definitely try this place again!
è™¾é¥ºã€å‡¤çˆªã€é…¿é’æ¤’ç‰¹åˆ«å¥½åƒï¼å¥¶é»„åŒ…ï¼Œçƒ§å–ï¼ŒèŒ„å­ï¼Œè‚ ç²‰è¿˜ä¸é”™ã€‚å‰çƒ§é¤åŒ…æœ‰æ´‹è‘±ã€‚æœ‰Valet parkingå¾ˆæ–¹ä¾¿ã€‚å±…ç„¶æ˜¯å°æ¨è½¦çš„å½¢å¼ï¼Œæœ‰ç§å°æ—¶å€™çš„æ„Ÿè§‰äº†ã€‚
At part of our food fest in Flushing, This shop offers great seafood, rice and noodles dishes. They also have dim sum.  Always try to visit whenever we are in town ğŸ˜ğŸ‘

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Asian Jewels, and it exceeded my expectations! The dim sum was particularly amazing - it was incredibly fresh and the carts were constantly rotating around so we were able to sample a variety ofâ€¦

I've been coming here for probably close to 20 years and the food is always great here. Consistent and I've never had a bad time. Come here for dim sum, dinner or even a banquet and the food is a great reflection of Cantonese cuisine. Although some of the things are slight departures of the dishes you'd fine in Hong Kong, they're tasty nonetheless. Definitely one of the best dim sum spots in Flushing. There's valet parking, but can get full easily during the weekends so I'd recommend parking at the Skyview Mall instead and just walk over.
